page.title: 02Why "Hexhamshire"
page.content: History books tell us that "In the seventh century,{Hexhamshire}was that part of the marriage dower of Etheldeda, wife of King Egfrith, King of Northumbria, which she bestowed upon her favourite, St Wilfrid, Archbishop of York." Originally{Hexhamshire}covered a wide area, including{Hexham}itself, and as far as{St John Lee}to the north, and {Allendale}to the west. Nowadays it covers the{present survey}area,and stretches to Slaley Forest to the south.{Administratively}, the name is kept in the{Parish Councils}of {Hexhamshire}, and{Hexhamshire Low {Quarter}.Although the population is widely-scattered, it is also a very active and close-knit{rural community} with its own church,school,sportsfield and village hall -but no shop!
